article: I was blind, but I was ashamed of it if it was known. I refused to use a white stick and _ asking for help. After all, I was a teenage girl, and I couldn t bear people to look at me and think I was not _ them. I must have been a terrible danger on the roads. Coming across me wandering through the traffic, motorists probably would have to step _ on their brakes. Apart from that, there were all sorts of disasters that used to occur on the way to and from work.One evening, I got off the bus about halfway home where I had to change buses, and as usual I _ something. I m awfully sorry, I said and stepped forward only to run into it again. When it happened a third time, I realized I had been _ to a lamppost. This was just one of the _ things that constantly happened to me. So I carried on and found the bus stop, which was a request stop, where the bus wouldn t stop _ passengers wanted to get on or off. No one else was there and I had to try to guess if the bus had arrived.Generally in this situation, because I hated _ I was blind by asking for help, I tried to guess at the sound. Sometimes I would _ a big lorry and stand there feeling stupid as it drew away. In the end, I usually managed to _ my pride and ask someone at the stop for help. _ on this particular evening no one joined me at the stop; it seemed that everyone had suddenly decided not to travel by bus. Of course I heard plenty of buses pass, or I thought I did. But because I had given up stopping them _ making a fool of myself. I let them all go by. I stood there alone for half an hour without stopping one. Then I gave up. I decided to walk on to the next stop.
